duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide in-home, ABA-based therapy sessions to families and children on the autism spectrum.
Engage in continuous training and skill development in Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA).
Work with children and individuals with special needs, demonstrating patience and empathy.
Adhere to a flexible schedule, including afternoons/early evenings and possible weekend morning hours.
Ensure reliable transportation, valid driver’s license, auto registration, and auto insurance for home visits.
Conduct initial 2-week training schedule (M-F, approximately 35 hours) and participate in ongoing paid training and supervision.
Participate in lifting, carrying, loading/unloading toys and materials, as well as frequent walking, bending, reaching, squatting, kneeling, and twisting during interactions.
Maintain coverage in designated areas, including Anaheim, Santa Ana, Orange, Garden Grove, Tustin, or surrounding cities.

education_certification.credential: At least some college coursework in a related field (Degree not required)
Preference for programs related to early childhood education, psychology, nursing, or a related field
